title: Foundation: G.C.E. O/L and Technical Aptitude
description: A good pass in G.C.E. O/L, especially in Mathematics and Science, is the starting point. Having a natural interest in how things work and hands-on problem-solving is crucial. Pursuing the A/L Technology stream can be an advantage.

title: Vocational Training & NVQ Qualification
description: Enroll in a technician course at a recognized vocational training institute. Choose a specialization based on your interest, such as Electrical, Mechanical, Automotive, or AC & Refrigeration. The goal is to achieve an NVQ Level 4 certification.
skills: Specialized technical knowledge (e.g., wiring, engine repair)
institutes: Sri Lanka-Korea National Vocational Training Institute

title: Technician
description: Work as a qualified technician in your chosen field. Your responsibilities will include installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of equipment and systems. This is where you apply your training to real-world problems.
institutes: Automobile service centers (e.g., DIMO, Toyota Lanka)

title: Senior Technician & Further Qualification
description: Become a senior technician, handling more complex tasks and possibly supervising junior staff. To progress further, consider pursuing a higher-level qualification like an NVQ Level 5/6 (equivalent to a diploma/higher diploma).

title: Technical Supervisor / Foreman / Entrepreneur
description: Advance to a supervisory role, managing a team of technicians and overseeing all technical operations in a workshop or on a site. With extensive experience and business acumen, many senior technicians also start their own successful service and repair businesses.
